kpis.description: Net Profit Margin measures the percentage of revenue that remains as profit after all expenses are deducted. It indicates how effectively a company converts revenue into actual profit.
kpis.formula: Net Profit Margin = (Net Profit / Total Revenue) * 100

kpis.description: Return on Equity (ROE) measures the profitability of a company in relation to shareholders' equity. It indicates how effectively management is using a company’s assets to create profits.
Sales Growth Rate measures the increase in sales over a specific period, expressed as a percentage. It indicates how quickly a company is growing its sales.
kpis.formula: Sales Growth Rate = ((Current Period Sales - Previous Period Sales) / Previous Period Sales) * 100

kpis.description: Operating Cash Flow Margin measures the proportion of revenue that is converted into operating cash flow. It indicates the efficiency of a company in generating cash from its operations.
kpis.formula: Operating Cash Flow Margin = (Operating Cash Flow / Total Revenue) * 100

kpis.description: Marketing Return on Investment (ROI) measures the revenue generated for every dollar spent on marketing. It indicates the effectiveness of marketing campaigns in generating profit.
kpis.formula: Marketing ROI = ((Revenue Attributed to Marketing - Marketing Investment) / Marketing Investment) * 100
